SENT.plain: We report a family and a single patient in China involved with merosin-deficient congenital muscular dystrophy (MDC1A) with typical clinical symptoms
Pathological analysis of biopsied skeletal muscle showed dystrophic changes with proliferated fibrotic tissue elements as the predominant finding
Immunohistochemical analysis demonstrated the complete absence of the laminin alpha2 chain (merosin) around muscle fibers
In patient 1, a double mutation, c.[9101_9104dupAACA:3412G>A] p.[H3035QfsX4:V1138M] was detected, whereas her parents and another sibling were heterozygous carriers
Patient 2 had a novel homozygous nonsense mutation, c.2907C>A (p.Cys969X), in exon 21
The genotype-phenotype correlation of Chinese children with novel merosin-deficient congenital muscular dystrophy is reported
